alert.note: Alert for San Diego (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 01 at 6:14AM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 910 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following county, San Diego. * WHEN...Until 910 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 614 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated moderate to locally heavy rain occurring. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.25 and 0.75 inches of rain have fallen in the past 6 hours. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.50 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... San Diego, Chula Vista, Imperial Beach, Oceanside, Carlsbad, San Marcos, Poway, El Cajon, Vista, Escondido, Encinitas, National City, La Mesa. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
